basics.name: Steven Placzek
basics.label: Electrical Engineering Student
basics.summary: Electrical Engineering student at Western New England University with hands-on experience in RF/microwave systems, 3D printing, and digital signal processing. FCC-licensed Amateur Radio Operator (KC1QNW).

work.name: NSF S-STEM Scholars Program, Holyoke Community College
work.summary: Directed a group project demonstrating the educational value of 3D printing in STEM.
highlights: Designed 34 unique 3D models representing STEM topics using OpenSCAD
Completed project in under two weeks; optimized prints via lattice structures
Reduced print time from ~12 to ~4 hours
Delivered 28 models to Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry faculty for interactive learning

work.name: Precision mmWave
work.summary: Conducted frequency response testing and verification for RF components.
highlights: Tested RF detectors (1-80 GHz), switches (12-48 GHz), and mixers (1-40 GHz)
Performed precision assembly with GaAs ICs under microscope
Installed and operated THOR Labs laser engraving equipment
Gained proficiency with spectrum analyzers, waveguides, and millimeter-wave components

work.name: Visual Audio Production Crew, Theater Dept., HCC
work.summary: Set up, programmed, and operated theater lighting for 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' ensuring consistent visual effects.

awards.title: Community Foundation of Western Massachusetts Scholarship
Big Y Scholarship for Academic Excellence

certificates.name: FCC Amateur Radio License - General Class
FCC Amateur Radio License - Technician Class

projects.name: Waveguide Slot Array Antenna
projects.summary: Designed an 8×8 element waveguide resonant longitudinal slot array antenna at 14 GHz fed by WR 62 waveguide using MATLAB and HFSS.

projects.name: Pyramidal Horn Antenna
projects.summary: Designed a pyramidal horn antenna with 25 dB gain at 14 GHz fed by WR 62 waveguide using MATLAB and HFSS.

projects.name: Microstrip Patch Antenna
projects.summary: Designed a 16 GHz probe-fed microstrip patch antenna using MATLAB and HFSS.

projects.name: Broadband Amplifier
projects.summary: Designed a 10-20 GHz amplifier with 8.15 dB ± 0.17 dB gain using MATLAB and ADS.
highlights: EE 456 RF & Microwave Active Circuit Design

projects.name: Low Noise Amplifier
projects.summary: Designed a 15 GHz low noise amplifier using MATLAB and ADS.
highlights: EE 456 RF & Microwave Active Circuit Design

projects.name: Digital Motor Control System
projects.summary: Designed a real-time digital control system for an industrial DC motor meeting specifications for peak time, delay, settling time, and percent overshoot using MATLAB and Simulink.

projects.name: Digital Hearing Aid Filter Bank
projects.summary: Designed a FIR filter bank with 16 individually tailored filters for restoring hearing based on audiogram profiles.

volunteer.summary: Region R1 - Springfield Section. Participating in autonomous maze-solving robot competition at MIT (April 2026).

volunteer.organization: National Society of Leadership and Success
